numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Some students are from middle-class families.
2. Some students are from high-income families.
3. A student from a middle-class family is at a disadvantage compared to a student from a high-income family for admission to a good college.
4. Some students have a family member.
5. Some family members attended the same institution in the past.
6. If a family member attended the same institution in the past then the student gets an unfair advantage for admission.
8. A large institution takes donations as part of the admissions process.
11. A low-income family cannot pay such donations.
12. A middle-income family cannot pay such donations.
